  16. (* Transformation of Mach code into a list of pseudo-instructions. *)
  17. open Linear

  19. (* Cons a simple instruction (arg, res, live empty) *)

  21. ‌let cons_instr d n =
  22.   { desc = d; next = n; arg = [||]; res = [||];
  23.     dbg = Debuginfo.none; live = Reg.Set.empty }

  25. (* Build an instruction with arg, res, dbg, live taken from
  26.    the given Mach.instruction *)

  28. ‌let copy_instr d i n =
  29.   { desc = d; next = n;
  30.     arg = i.Mach.arg; res = i.Mach.res;
  31.     dbg = i.Mach.dbg; live = i.Mach.live }

  33. (*
  34.    Label the beginning of the given instruction sequence.
  35.    - If the sequence starts with a branch, jump over it.
  36.    - If the sequence is the end, (tail call position), just do nothing
  37. *)

  39. ‌let get_label n = match n.desc with
  40.     Lbranch lbl -> (lbl, n)
  41.   | Llabel lbl -> (lbl, n)
  42.   | Lend -> (-1, n)
  43.   | _ -> let lbl = Cmm.new_label() in (lbl, cons_instr (Llabel lbl) n)

  45. (* Check the fallthrough label *)
  46. ‌let check_label n = match n.desc with
  47.   | Lbranch lbl -> lbl
  48.   | Llabel lbl -> lbl
  49.   | _ -> -1


  52. (* Add pseudo-instruction Ladjust_trap_depth in front of a continuation
  53.    to notify assembler generation about updates to the stack as a result
  54.    of differences in exception trap depths.
  55.    The argument delta is the number of trap frames (not bytes). *)

  57. ‌let rec adjust_trap_depth delta_traps next =
  58.   (* Simplify by merging and eliminating Ladjust_trap_depth instructions
  59.      whenever possible. *)
  60.   match next.desc with
  61.   | Ladjust_trap_depth { delta_traps = k } ->
  62.     adjust_trap_depth (delta_traps + k) next.next
  63.   | _ ->
  64.     if delta_traps = 0 then next
  65.     else cons_instr (Ladjust_trap_depth { delta_traps }) next

  67. (* Discard all instructions up to the next label.
  68.    This function is to be called before adding a non-terminating
  69.    instruction. *)

  71. ‌let rec discard_dead_code n =
  72.   let adjust trap_depth =
  73.     adjust_trap_depth trap_depth (discard_dead_code n.next)
  74.   in
  75.   match n.desc with
  76.     Lend -> n
  77.   | Llabel _ -> n
  78.     (* Do not discard Lpoptrap/Lpushtrap/Ladjust_trap_depth
  79.        or Istackoffset instructions, as this may cause a stack imbalance
  80.        later during assembler generation. Replace them
  81.        with pseudo-instruction Ladjust_trap_depth with the corresponding
  82.        stack offset and eliminate dead instructions after them. *)
  83.   | Lpoptrap -> adjust (-1)
  84.   | Lpushtrap _ -> adjust (+1)
  85.   | Ladjust_trap_depth { delta_traps } -> adjust delta_traps
  86.   | Lop(Istackoffset _) ->
  87.     (* This dead instruction cannot be replaced by Ladjust_trap_depth,
  88.        because the units don't match: the argument of Istackoffset is in bytes,
  89.        whereas the argument of Ladjust_trap_depth is in trap frames,
  90.        and the size of trap frames is machine-dependant and therefore not
  91.        available here.  *)
  92.     { n with next = discard_dead_code n.next; }
  93.   | _ -> discard_dead_code n.next

  95. (*
  96.    Add a branch in front of a continuation.
  97.    Discard dead code in the continuation.
  98.    Does not insert anything if we're just falling through
  99.    or if we jump to dead code after the end of function (lbl=-1)
  100. *)

  102. ‌let add_branch lbl n =
  103.   if lbl >= 0 then
  104.     let n1 = discard_dead_code n in
  105.     match n1.desc with
  106.     | Llabel lbl1 when lbl1 = lbl -> n1
  107.     | _ -> cons_instr (Lbranch lbl) n1
  108.   else
  109.     discard_dead_code n


  112. ‌type exit_info = {
  113.   try_depth : int;
  114.   exit_label : (int * (int * int)) list;
  115.   (* Association list: exit handler -> (handler label, try-nesting factor) *)
  116. }

  118. ‌let find_exit_label_try_depth exit_info k =
  119.   try
  120.     List.assoc k exit_info.exit_label
  121.   with
  122.   | Not_found -> Misc.fatal_error "Linearize.find_exit_label"

  124. ‌let find_exit_label exit_info k =
  125.   let (label, t) = find_exit_label_try_depth exit_info k in
  126.   assert(t = exit_info.try_depth);
  127.   label

  129. ‌let is_next_catch exit_info n =
  130.   match exit_info.exit_label with
  131.   | (n0,(_,t))::_  when n0=n && t = exit_info.try_depth -> true
  132.   | _ -> false

  134. ‌let local_exit exit_info k =
  135.   snd (find_exit_label_try_depth exit_info k) = exit_info.try_depth

  137. (* Linearize an instruction [i]: add it in front of the continuation [n] *)
  138. ‌let linear i n contains_calls =
  139.   let rec linear exit_info i n =
  140.     match i.Mach.desc with
  141.       Iend -> n
  142.     | Iop(Itailcall_ind | Itailcall_imm _ as op) ->
  143.         copy_instr (Lop op) i (discard_dead_code n)
  144.     | Iop(Imove | Ireload | Ispill)
  145.       when i.Mach.arg.(0).loc = i.Mach.res.(0).loc ->
  146.         linear exit_info i.Mach.next n
  147.     | Iop((Ipoll { return_label = None; _ }) as op) ->
  148.         (* If the poll call does not already specify where to jump to after
  149.            the poll (the expected situation in the current implementation),
  150.            absorb any branch after the poll call into the poll call itself.
  151.            This, in particular, optimises polls at the back edges of loops. *)
  152.         let n = linear exit_info i.Mach.next n in
  153.         let op, n =
  154.           match n.desc with
  155.           | Lbranch lbl ->
  156.             Mach.Ipoll { return_label = Some lbl }, n.next
  157.           | _ -> op, n
  158.         in
  159.         copy_instr (Lop op) i n
  160.     | Iop op ->
  161.         copy_instr (Lop op) i (linear exit_info i.Mach.next n)
  162.     | Ireturn ->
  163.         let n1 = copy_instr Lreturn i (discard_dead_code n) in
  164.         if contains_calls
  165.         then cons_instr Lreloadretaddr n1
  166.         else n1
  167.     | Iifthenelse(test, ifso, ifnot) ->
  168. ‌        let n1 = linear exit_info i.Mach.next n in
  169.         begin match (ifso.Mach.desc, ifnot.Mach.desc, n1.desc) with
  170.           Iend, _, Lbranch lbl ->
  171.             copy_instr (Lcondbranch(test, lbl)) i (linear exit_info ifnot n1)
  172.         | _, Iend, Lbranch lbl ->
  173.             copy_instr
  174.               (Lcondbranch(invert_test test, lbl))
  175.               i
  176.               (linear exit_info ifso n1)
  177.         | Iexit nfail1, Iexit nfail2, _
  178.           when is_next_catch exit_info nfail1
  179.             && local_exit exit_info nfail2 ->
  180. ‌            let lbl2 = find_exit_label exit_info nfail2 in
  181.             copy_instr
  182.               (Lcondbranch (invert_test test, lbl2))
  183.               i
  184.               (linear exit_info ifso n1)
  185.         | Iexit nfail, _, _ when local_exit exit_info nfail ->
  186. ‌            let n2 = linear exit_info ifnot n1
  187.             and lbl = find_exit_label exit_info nfail in
  188.             copy_instr (Lcondbranch(test, lbl)) i n2
  189.         | _,  Iexit nfail, _ when local_exit exit_info nfail ->
  190. ‌            let n2 = linear exit_info ifso n1 in
  191. ‌            let lbl = find_exit_label exit_info nfail in
  192.             copy_instr (Lcondbranch(invert_test test, lbl)) i n2
  193.         | Iend, _, _ ->
  194. ‌            let (lbl_end, n2) = get_label n1 in
  195.             copy_instr
  196.               (Lcondbranch(test, lbl_end))
  197.               i
  198.               (linear exit_info ifnot n2)
  199.         | _,  Iend, _ ->
  200. ‌            let (lbl_end, n2) = get_label n1 in
  201.             copy_instr (Lcondbranch(invert_test test, lbl_end)) i
  202.                        (linear exit_info ifso n2)
  203.         | _, _, _ ->
  204.           (* Should attempt branch prediction here *)
  205. ‌            let (lbl_end, n2) = get_label n1 in
  206. ‌            let (lbl_else, nelse) = get_label (linear exit_info ifnot n2) in
  207.             copy_instr (Lcondbranch(invert_test test, lbl_else)) i
  208.               (linear exit_info ifso (add_branch lbl_end nelse))
  209.         end
  210.     | Iswitch(index, cases) ->
  211. ‌        let lbl_cases = Array.make (Array.length cases) 0 in
  212. ‌        let (lbl_end, n1) = get_label(linear exit_info i.Mach.next n) in
  213. ‌        let n2 = ref (discard_dead_code n1) in
  214.         for i = Array.length cases - 1 downto 0 do
  215. ‌          let case_linear =
  216.             linear exit_info cases.(i) (add_branch lbl_end !n2) in
  217. ‌          let (lbl_case, ncase) = get_label case_linear in
  218.           lbl_cases.(i) <- lbl_case;
  219.           n2 := discard_dead_code ncase
  220.         done;
  221.         (* Switches with 1 and 2 branches have been eliminated earlier.
  222.            Here, we do something for switches with 3 branches. *)
  223.         if Array.length index = 3 then begin
  224. ‌          let fallthrough_lbl = check_label !n2 in
  225. ‌          let find_label n =
  226.             let lbl = lbl_cases.(index.(n)) in
  227.             if lbl = fallthrough_lbl then None else Some lbl in
  228.           copy_instr (Lcondbranch3(find_label 0, find_label 1, find_label 2))
  229.                      i !n2
  230.         end else
  231.           copy_instr (Lswitch(Array.map (fun n -> lbl_cases.(n)) index)) i !n2
  232.     | Icatch(_rec_flag, handlers, body) ->
  233. ‌        let (lbl_end, n1) = get_label(linear exit_info i.Mach.next n) in
  234.         (* CR mshinwell for pchambart:
  235.            1. rename "io"
  236.            2. Make sure the test cases cover the "Iend" cases too *)
  237. ‌        let labels_at_entry_to_handlers = List.map (fun (_nfail, handler) ->
  238.             match handler.Mach.desc with
  239.             | Iend -> lbl_end
  240.             | _ -> Cmm.new_label ())
  241.             handlers in
  242. ‌        let exit_label_add = List.map2
  243.             (fun (nfail, _) lbl -> (nfail, (lbl, exit_info.try_depth)))
  244.             handlers labels_at_entry_to_handlers in
  245. ‌        let exit_info =
  246.           { exit_info with exit_label = exit_label_add @ exit_info.exit_label }
  247.         in
  248. ‌        let n2 = List.fold_left2 (fun n (_nfail, handler) lbl_handler ->
  249.             match handler.Mach.desc with
  250.             | Iend -> n
  251.             | _ ->
  252.                 cons_instr (Llabel lbl_handler)
  253.                   (linear exit_info handler (add_branch lbl_end n)))
  254.             n1 handlers labels_at_entry_to_handlers
  255.         in
  256. ‌        let n3 = linear exit_info body (add_branch lbl_end n2) in
  257.         n3
  258.     | Iexit nfail ->
  259. ‌        let lbl, t = find_exit_label_try_depth exit_info nfail in
  260.         assert (i.Mach.next.desc = Mach.Iend);
  261. ‌        let delta_traps = exit_info.try_depth - t in
  262. ‌        let n1 = adjust_trap_depth delta_traps n in
  263. ‌        let rec loop i tt =
  264.           if t = tt then i
  265.           else loop (cons_instr Lpoptrap i) (tt - 1)
  266.         in
  267.         loop (add_branch lbl n1) exit_info.try_depth
  268.     | Itrywith(body, handler) ->
  269. ‌        let (lbl_join, n1) = get_label (linear exit_info i.Mach.next n) in
  270. ‌        let (lbl_handler, n2) =
  271.           get_label (cons_instr Lentertrap (linear exit_info handler n1))
  272.         in
  273. ‌        let exit_info =
  274.           { exit_info with try_depth = exit_info.try_depth + 1 } in
  275.         assert (i.Mach.arg = [| |]);
  276. ‌        let n3 = cons_instr (Lpushtrap { lbl_handler; })
  277.                    (linear exit_info body
  278.                       (cons_instr
  279.                          Lpoptrap
  280.                          (add_branch lbl_join n2))) in
  281.         n3

  283.     | Iraise k ->
  284.         copy_instr (Lraise k) i (discard_dead_code n)
  285.   in linear { exit_label = []; try_depth = 0 } i n

  287. ‌let add_prologue first_insn prologue_required =
  288.   let tailrec_entry_point_label = Cmm.new_label () in
  289.   let tailrec_entry_point =
  290.     { desc = Llabel tailrec_entry_point_label;
  291.       next = first_insn;
  292.       arg = [| |];
  293.       res = [| |];
  294.       dbg = first_insn.dbg;
  295.       live = first_insn.live;
  296.     }
  297.   in
  298.   (* We expect [Lprologue] to expand to at least one instruction---as such,
  299.      if no prologue is required, we avoid adding the instruction here.
  300.      The reason is subtle: an empty expansion of [Lprologue] can cause
  301.      two labels, one either side of the [Lprologue], to point at the same
  302.      location.  This means that we lose the property (cf. [Coalesce_labels])
  303.      that we can check if two labels point at the same location by
  304.      comparing them for equality.  This causes trouble when the function
  305.      whose prologue is in question lands at the top of the object file
  306.      and we are emitting DWARF debugging information:
  307.        foo_code_begin:
  308.        foo:
  309.        .L1:
  310.        ; empty prologue
  311.        .L2:
  312.        ...
  313.      If we were to emit a location list entry from L1...L2, not realising
  314.      that they point at the same location, then the beginning and ending
  315.      points of the range would be both equal to each other and (relative to
  316.      "foo_code_begin") equal to zero.  This appears to confuse objdump,
  317.      which seemingly misinterprets the entry as an end-of-list entry
  318.      (which is encoded with two zero words), then complaining about a
  319.      "hole in location list" (as it ignores any remaining list entries
  320.      after the misinterpreted entry). *)
  321.   if prologue_required then
  322.     let prologue =
  323.       { desc = Lprologue;
  324.         next = tailrec_entry_point;
  325.         arg = [| |];
  326.         res = [| |];
  327.         dbg = tailrec_entry_point.dbg;
  328.         live = Reg.Set.empty;  (* will not be used *)
  329.       }
  330.     in
  331.     tailrec_entry_point_label, prologue
  332.   else
  333.     tailrec_entry_point_label, tailrec_entry_point

  335. ‌let fundecl f =
  336.   let fun_prologue_required = Proc.prologue_required f in
  337.   let contains_calls = f.Mach.fun_contains_calls in
  338.   let fun_tailrec_entry_point_label, fun_body =
  339.     add_prologue (linear f.Mach.fun_body end_instr contains_calls)
  340.       fun_prologue_required
  341.   in
  342.   { fun_name = f.Mach.fun_name;
  343.     fun_args = Reg.set_of_array f.Mach.fun_args;
  344.     fun_body;
  345.     fun_fast = not (List.mem Cmm.Reduce_code_size f.Mach.fun_codegen_options);
  346.     fun_dbg  = f.Mach.fun_dbg;
  347.     fun_tailrec_entry_point_label;
  348.     fun_contains_calls = contains_calls;
  349.     fun_num_stack_slots = f.Mach.fun_num_stack_slots;
  350.     fun_frame_required = Proc.frame_required f;
  351.     fun_prologue_required;
  352.   }
